meanings.definition: Opposition to secrecy or the practice of keeping things secret.
meanings.sent1: The group's antisecrecy led them to share all their plans openly.
meanings.sent2: Her strong antisecrecy stance made her a trustworthy confidante.
meanings.sent3: The antisecrecy of the surprise party was ruined when the guest of honor found out.
meanings.sent4: In a world of deceit, his antisecrecy shone like a beacon of honesty.
meanings.sent5: The antisecrecy of the transparent glass walls made the office feel welcoming and open.

meanings.definition: The belief or practice of being against secrecy.
meanings.sent1: Their antisecrecy was evident in their commitment to full disclosure.
meanings.sent2: The company's culture promoted antisecrecy and open communication.
meanings.sent3: The antisecrecy of the gossiping neighbors was both amusing and annoying.
meanings.sent4: Her antisecrecy was a shield against the hidden agendas of others.
meanings.sent5: The antisecrecy of the town's mayor made him a favorite among the residents.
